analyzed: 'od srung / de ltar skyes bu dam pa de gnyis kyis dge slong dang / lha de dag zab mo'i bzod pa yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pas /
translated: “Kāśyapa, those two holy beings caused those monks and gods to take up the acceptance of the profound.

analyzed: de phyin chad de dag thams cad bdag gi don la sbyar ba'i rjes su brtson pa dang / bya ba nyung ngur gnas pas gnas par gyur cing /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir brtson par yang mi byed do //
translated: They did not apply themselves to the activity of making offerings to the Tathāgata’s relics.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gi sems chos zab mo bla na med pa yang dag pa nyid la zhugs par gyur pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'od @209a *// srung; de nas zhag bdun 'das nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten de dag thams cad kyang sa la nub par gyur / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung de dag thams cad kyang sprog mar blugs pa bzhin nam /
translated: “Kāśyapa, after seven days had passed, all those stūpas of the Tathāgata sank into the ground.🔽All those relics of the Tathāgata disappeared into the ground, as if they had been wrapped in a cloth

original: snod du blugs pa bzhin du de nyid du mi snang bar gyur te /
analyzed: snod du blugs pa bzhin du de nyid du mi snang bar gyur te /

analyzed: 'od srung / de lta bas na skyes bu dam pa de dag gi rjes su bslab par bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, therefore, you should train in the practice of those holy beings.

original: 'od srung; yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i dge slong lus ma bsgoms pa /

translated: “Kāśyapa, in the future there will be monks of the vehicle of the hearers and of the vehicle of the bodhisattvas who have not cultivated their bodies,

original: sems ma bsgoms pa /
analyzed: sems ma bsgoms pa /
translated: who have not cultivated their minds,

original: tshul khrims ma bsgoms pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims ma bsgoms pa /
translated: who have not cultivated their discipline,

original: shes rab ma bsgoms pa kha cig 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes rab ma bsgoms pa kha cig 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: and who have not cultivated their insight.

original: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gi mchod pas 'tsho bar sems kyi /🔽mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gi mchod pas 'tsho bar sems kyi / mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ma yin zhing /
translated: They will think that they should make a living by worshipping the relics of the Tathāgata,🔽but not for the sake of nirvāṇa,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: and not for the sake of freedom from desire.

original: de dag ni bdag nyid tshul khrims 'chal ba dang / brjed ngas pa dang / shes rab 'chal ba dang / rnam par ma grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba ma yin bzhin du 'tsho ba tsam gyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag nyid tshul khrims 'chal ba dang / brjed ngas pa dang / shes rab 'chal ba dang / rnam par ma grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba ma yin bzhin du 'tsho ba tsam gyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung tshul khrims dang /
translated: They are themselves immoral, forgetful, unintelligent, unliberated, and lacking in the insight of liberation, yet they think that for the sake of mere livelihood they should revere, honor, and worship the relics of the Tathāgata, which are imbued with morality,

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas yongs su bsgos pa dag la bkur sti bya ba dang / ri mo bya ba dang / mchod par bya bar sems so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas yongs su bsgos pa dag la bkur sti bya ba dang / ri mo bya ba dang / mchod par bya bar sems so //
translated: concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the insight of liberation.

original: de dag ni bdag nyid 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang @209b bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bcas pa yin bzhin du 'tsho ba tsam gyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag nyid 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang @209b bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bcas pa yin bzhin du 'tsho ba tsam gyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: They are themselves full of desire, hatred, and folly, yet they think that for the sake of mere livelihood they should revere, honor, and worship the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly awakened Buddha, who is free from desire,

original: zhe sdang dang bral ba /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral ba /
translated: free from hatred,🔽and free from folly.

original: gti mug dang bral ba'i sku gdung dag la bkur sti bya ba dang / ri mor bya ba dang / mchod par bya bar sems so //🔽de dag ni bdag nyid ser sna can dang / 'jungs pa dang / gnod sems dang / tha ba'i nyes pa mang ba dang / le lo dang ldan pa dang / brjed ngas pa dang / shes bzhin med pa yin bzhin du 'tsho btsam gyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa sbyin bdag chen po yang dag pa'i gnas la rab tu gnas pa mnyam par gzhag pa thugs rtse gcig pa'i sku gdung dag la bkur sti bya ba dang /
analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba'i sku gdung dag la bkur sti bya ba dang / ri mor bya ba dang / mchod par bya bar sems so // de dag ni bdag nyid ser sna can dang / 'jungs pa dang / gnod sems dang / tha ba'i nyes pa mang ba dang / le lo dang ldan pa dang / brjed ngas pa dang / shes bzhin med pa yin bzhin du 'tsho btsam gyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa sbyin bdag chen po yang dag pa'i gnas la rab tu gnas pa mnyam par gzhag pa thugs rtse gcig pa'i sku gdung dag la bkur sti bya ba dang /
translated: They think to honor, venerate, and make offerings to the relics that are free from delusion.

original: ri mo bya ba dang / mchod pa bya bar sems so //🔽'od srung / nga ni rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo las dang po pa dag gi sems mngon par dad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ri mo bya ba dang / mchod pa bya bar sems so // 'od srung / nga ni rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo las dang po pa dag gi sems mngon par dad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: They are themselves stingy, greedy, malicious, and full of many faults, lazy, forgetful, and lacking in vigilance, and yet they think to honor, venerate, and make offerings to the relics of the Thus-Gone One, the great benefactor who is perfectly settled in the true state, one-pointed in concentration, and who is the very embodiment of generosity.🔽Kāśyapa, I consecrate the relics in order to inspire the minds of those sons and daughters of good family who are beginners

original: sku gdung rnams byin gyis rlob par mdzad de /
analyzed: sku gdung rnams byin gyis rlob par mdzad de /
translated: to have faith.

original: gang dag de dag la mchod pa byed pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gang dag de dag la mchod pa byed pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who make offerings to them

original: lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: will experience the excellence of gods and humans.

original: de yang de dag gi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar gyi rgyur 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: de yang de dag gi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar gyi rgyur 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: That will be the cause for their complete nirvāṇa.

original: mi blun po de dag ni bstan pa 'di la rab tu byung nas ngas dge sbyong gi las su gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gis bor zhing btang la /🔽bdag nyid gso ba'i don dang / mdza' shes kyi khyim dang / slong mo ster ba'i khyim dag yongs su smin par bya @210a *//
analyzed: mi blun po de dag ni bstan pa 'di la rab tu byung nas ngas dge sbyong gi las su gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gis bor zhing btang la / bdag nyid gso ba'i don dang / mdza' shes kyi khyim dang / slong mo ster ba'i khyim dag yongs su smin par bya @210a *//
translated: But those foolish people, having gone forth in this teaching, have abandoned and rejected what I have taught to be the work of a renunciate.🔽They have done so for the sake of their own livelihood, for the sake of ripening the families of their friends and the families who give them alms,

original: ba'i don dang / lhung bzed dang chos gos yongs su btsal ba'i don dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti mngon par bsgrub pa'i don dang / snyan pa dang / sgra dang / grags pa yongs su bsgrub pa'i don gyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung dang /
analyzed: ba'i don dang / lhung bzed dang chos gos yongs su btsal ba'i don dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti mngon par bsgrub pa'i don dang / snyan pa dang / sgra dang / grags pa yongs su bsgrub pa'i don gyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung dang /
translated: for the sake of seeking out alms bowls and robes, for the sake of acquiring gain and honor, and for the sake of achieving fame, reputation, and renown.

original: mchod rten la mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba'i las kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung dang / mchod rten dag la bkur sti nye bar sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: mchod rten la mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba'i las kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung dang / mchod rten dag la bkur sti nye bar sgrub par byed do //
translated: By the activity of making offerings and venerating stūpas, one establishes respect for the relics and stūpas of the Tathāgatas.

original: 'od srung / de la dge sbyong gi las gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'od srung / de la dge sbyong gi las gang zhe na /
translated: Kāśyapa, what is the activity of spiritual practitioners?

original: 'od srung / ngas las gnyis po bsam gtan dang / kha ton bya ba bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / ngas las gnyis po bsam gtan dang / kha ton bya ba bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, those two activities that I have taught—meditative concentration and recitation—

original: las de gnyis kyang lam la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir bstan par zad kyi /
analyzed: las de gnyis kyang lam la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir bstan par zad kyi /
translated: are taught in order to enter the path.

original: de dag kyang shin tu mthar thug pa dang / shin tu mthar phyin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang shin tu mthar thug pa dang / shin tu mthar phyin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not the ultimate, the supreme.

original: 'od srung / las gang las zad par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa de ni dge sbyong gi las yin te /
analyzed: 'od srung / las gang las zad par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa de ni dge sbyong gi las yin te /
translated: Kāśyapa, that activity which is engaged in for the exhaustion of karma is the activity of spiritual practitioners.

original: bya ba med pa dang / nyes pa mi byung ba dang / log par mi byed pa dang / dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med pa dang / nyams pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / rnam par thar ba'i sgo gsum po dag mngon du byed pa dang /
analyzed: bya ba med pa dang / nyes pa mi byung ba dang / log par mi byed pa dang / dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med pa dang / nyams pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / rnam par thar ba'i sgo gsum po dag mngon du byed pa dang /
translated: It is to be without activity, to be without fault, to be without error, to be without memory, to be without attention, to be without decline, to be unborn, and to actualize the three gates of liberation.

original: khams gsum du mtshams sbyor ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa dang / 'ong ba med pa gang yin pa de ni dge sbyong gi las zhes bya ba yin na /
analyzed: khams gsum du mtshams sbyor ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa dang / 'ong ba med pa gang yin pa de ni dge sbyong gi las zhes bya ba yin na /
translated: It is to not connect with the three realms, to not go, and to not come.

original: mi blun po de dag ni dge sbyong gi las de lta bu de dag spangs te /
analyzed: mi blun po de dag ni dge sbyong gi las de lta bu de dag spangs te /
translated: Those foolish people abandon such activities of spiritual practice

analyzed: las gzhan dang gzhan dag yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: and seek out other activities.

analyzed: de dag ni ngas khyim na gnas @210b pa gos dkar po can rnams kyis bslab par gsungs pa gang yin pa de tsam la yang slob par mi byed de /
translated: They do not even train in what I have taught as the training for those who are householders wearing white clothes.

analyzed: khyim na gnas pa gos dkar po can rnams kyang re zhig de bzhin gshegs pas bslab pa ji ltar bcas pa rnams slob pa byed pa na /
translated: Even householders wearing white clothes, who are not renunciates, will attain the fruit of non-returner if they train in the precepts as taught by the Tathāgata.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur na mi blun po de dag ni bstan pa 'di la rab tu byung nas rnam par grol ba dang rjes su mthun pa tsam yang bsgom par mi byed na 'thob par lta ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur na mi blun po de dag ni bstan pa 'di la rab tu byung nas rnam par grol ba dang rjes su mthun pa tsam yang bsgom par mi byed na 'thob par lta ga la 'gyur te /
translated: But those fools, having gone forth in this teaching, will not even cultivate mere conformity with liberation, let alone attain it.

original: de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: de ni gnas med do //
translated: That is impossible.

original: 'od srung / yang phyi ma'i tshe phyi ma'i dus lnga brgya tha ma de la ming gis zil gyis non cing /
analyzed: 'od srung / yang phyi ma'i tshe phyi ma'i dus lnga brgya tha ma de la ming gis zil gyis non cing /
translated: Kāśyapa, in the future, in the final five hundred years, there will be monks who are overcome by names,

analyzed: kha dog dang / rtags dang; dbyibs kyis dge slong du 'gyur gyi /
translated: who will be monks by name, color, signs, and shape,

original: tshul khrims kyis ma yin /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ma yin /
translated: but not by morality,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis ma yin /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis ma yin /
translated: not by meditative concentration,

original: shes rab kyis ma yin pa dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes rab kyis ma yin pa dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: and not by wisdom.

original: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na / mi gsang sngags dang / sman dag gis gos la 'debs shing bgo bar byed la /🔽gang gis gos de gyon pa na zhag bdun nam /
analyzed: dper na / mi gsang sngags dang / sman dag gis gos la 'debs shing bgo bar byed la / gang gis gos de gyon pa na zhag bdun nam /
translated: For example, suppose there were a person who, through mantra and medicine, had empowered a garment to be worn.

original: zhag brgyad kyis de'i lus me lce gcig tu gyur cing kun du 'bar bar byed pa la la zhig yod par gyur cing /
analyzed: zhag brgyad kyis de'i lus me lce gcig tu gyur cing kun du 'bar bar byed pa la la zhig yod par gyur cing /
translated: Whoever put on that garment would, within seven or eight days, have their body become a single flame and be completely burned.

analyzed: des gos de gsang sngags dang sman dag gis btab cing yongs su bgos nas mi mdza' ba la la zhig la 'di lta ste /
translated: Having empowered and completely empowered that garment with mantra and medicine, he would give it to someone who was not a friend,

original: mdza' bshes kyi tshul gyis ster bar gyur la /
analyzed: mdza' bshes kyi tshul gyis ster bar gyur la /
translated: as if it were a gift of a friend.

original: de nas mi des kyang gos de mdzes pa yin par rig nas len par byed cing blangs nas gos de gyon par gyur na /
analyzed: de nas mi des kyang gos de mdzes pa yin par rig nas len par byed cing blangs nas gos de gyon par gyur na /
translated: Then, that person, knowing that garment to be beautiful, would take it and, having taken it, would put on that garment.

analyzed: de nas zhag bdun nam / zhag brgyad 'das nas mi de khyim du song ngam /
translated: After seven or eight days,

original: lam po cher song ba na /
analyzed: lam po cher song ba na /
translated: that person, having gone to his house or having gone to the main road,🔽would be burned by that garment.

original: gos de rab tu 'bar bar gyur cing /
analyzed: gos de rab tu 'bar bar gyur cing /
translated: The cloth would be ablaze,

original: de nas mi de gzhi de las tshul ma yin pa'i sdug bsngal skyes par gyur te /
analyzed: de nas mi de gzhi de las tshul ma yin pa'i sdug bsngal skyes par gyur te /

original: tshig par gyur /
analyzed: tshig par gyur /

original: shi bar gyur na /
analyzed: shi bar gyur na /
translated: and if it were to die,

original: 'od srung / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di ji snyam du sems /

original: gos de las ro myang ba ni ji tsam zhig yod /
analyzed: gos de las ro myang ba ni ji tsam zhig yod /
translated: How much taste is there in that cloth?

original: nyes dmigs ni ji tsam zhig yod snyam /

translated: How much misfortune is there?”

original: 'od srung gis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'od srung gis gsol pa /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ro myang ba ni chung lags kyi /
analyzed: ro myang ba ni chung lags kyi /

original: nyes dmigs ni dpag tu ma mchis lags so //

translated: but the misfortune is immeasurable.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'od srung / de bzhin du nga'i gos ngur smrig tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas bsgos pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang bskal pa bye ba grangs med pa nas legs par spyad pas yang dag par bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin du nga'i gos ngur smrig tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas bsgos pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang bskal pa bye ba grangs med pa nas legs par spyad pas yang dag par bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: “Kāśyapa, in the same way, my saffron robes, which are dyed with morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the vision of the wisdom of liberation, are accomplished through good conduct for countless millions of eons.

analyzed: mi blun po dge sbyong ltar bcos pa de dag ni drang srong gi rgyal mtshan gyon nas /

translated: They will enter villages, towns, cities, countries, and royal palaces.

original: bla mar byed /🔽ri mor byed /
analyzed: bla mar byed / ri mor byed /
translated: Then the faithful brahmins and householders will think, ‘They are ascetics,’ and will respect them.🔽They will revere them.🔽They will honor them.🔽They will make offerings to them.

original: mchod par byed par 'gyur zhing de dag gos ngur smrig gi gzhi de las mchod pa rnyed par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: mchod par byed par 'gyur zhing de dag gos ngur smrig gi gzhi de las mchod pa rnyed par 'gyur bas /

original: de dag des dga' ba @211b nyams su myong bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag des dga' ba @211b nyams su myong bar yang 'gyur ro //
